text: He took small pieces of blue cloth, longer than they were wide. He sewed both ends to the side of the last curtain in the first row. Then he did the same on the side of the last curtain in the second row.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put fifty of these pieces on the one curtain. And he put fifty on the side of the other curtain, so that the pieces met each other.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty hooks of gold. Then he joined the curtains together with the hooks so the meeting tent was as one.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made curtains of goat hair for a covering over the meeting tent. He made eleven curtains in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each curtain was as long as fifteen long steps, and as wide as two long steps, all of them the same.
speaker: Narrator

text: He joined five curtains by themselves and six curtains by themselves.
speaker: Narrator

text: He took fifty small pieces of cloth, longer than they were wide. He sewed both ends of each to the side of the last curtain in the first row. Then he sewed fifty pieces onto the side of the last curtain in the second row.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made fifty hooks of brass. And he put the hooks through the sewed pieces of cloth and joined the tent together as one.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a covering for the tent out of rams’ skins made red, and a covering of badgers’ skins over this.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the pillars of acacia wood for the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each piece of wood was as long as five long steps, and as wide as one step.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made two joining pieces in each piece of wood for joining them together. He did this for all the pieces of wood of the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made twenty pieces of wood for the south side of the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made forty silver bases under the twenty pieces of wood, two bases under each piece of wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made twenty pieces of wood for the north side of the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made forty silver bases, with two bases under each piece of wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made six pieces of wood for the back or west side of the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made two pieces of wood for the back corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were together at the bottom, and joined at the top with one ring. They were made the same for the two corners.
speaker: Narrator

text: There were eight pieces of wood, with sixteen silver bases, two under each piece of wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made long, straight pieces of acacia wood, five for the pieces of wood on one side of the meeting tent,
speaker: Narrator

text: and five for the pieces of wood on the other side of the meeting tent. Then he made five for the pieces of wood at the back of the meeting tent, the west side.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the long, straight cross-piece for the center to pass through from end to end.
speaker: Narrator

text: He covered the pieces of wood with gold. He made rings of gold to hold the long, straight pieces of wood. And he covered these pieces of wood with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the curtain of blue and purple and red cloth and fine linen. He made it with cherubim sewed into it by an able workman.
speaker: Narrator

text: He hung it on four pillars of acacia wood covered with gold. Their hooks were made of gold and he made four silver bases for it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a curtain for the door of the meeting tent out of blue, purple and red cloth and fine linen, the work of an able workman.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made five pillars with their hooks and covered their tops with gold. But he made their five bases of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the special box of the agreement of acacia wood, two and a half cubits long, one and a half cubits wide, and one and a half cubits tall.
speaker: Narrator

text: He covered it inside and out with pure gold. And he made a piece of gold to put on it all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made four rings of gold for it and put them on its four feet. He put two rings on one side of it and two rings on the other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made long pieces of acacia wood and covered them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he put the long pieces of wood through the rings on the sides of the special box to carry it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a mercy-seat of pure gold, two and a half cubits long, and one and a half cubits wide.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made two cherubim out of beaten gold at the two ends of the mercy-seat.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made one cherub on one end and one cherub on the other end. He made the cherubim and the mercy-seat of one piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: The cherubim had their wings spread up over the mercy-seat. Their faces were toward each other, and toward the mercy-seat.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made a table of acacia wood, two cubits long, one cubit wide, and one and a half cubits tall.
speaker: Narrator

text: He covered it with pure gold and made a gold piece around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a piece around it as wide as a hand. And he put gold on the side of this piece all around.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made four rings of gold for it. He put them on the four corners that were on the table’s four legs.
speaker: Narrator

text: The rings were close to the sides, to hold the long pieces of wood used to carry the table.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the long pieces of acacia wood and covered them with gold. The table was carried with these.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made of pure gold its plates, its pots and its jars, for pouring gifts of drink.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the lamp-stand of pure gold and the base of the lamp-stand of beaten gold. Its cups, its buds and its flowers were all made of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Six branches went out of its sides, three branches of the lamp-stand out of one side, and three branches out of its other side.
speaker: Narrator

text: Three cups were made to look like almond flowers, each with bud and flower, on one branch, and three on the next branch. This was done for all six branches going out of the lamp-stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the lamp-stand there were four cups made to look like almond flowers, with their buds and flowers.
speaker: Narrator

text: A bud was under each of the six branches going out of the lamp-stand.
speaker: Narrator

text: Their buds and their branches were of one piece with it. All of it was one piece of pure, beaten gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made its seven lamps, the tools for putting out the light, and its dishes of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made it and all its objects out of a piece of gold about half the weight of a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the altar for burning special perfume of acacia wood. It was one cubit long, one cubit wide, and as high as a man’s waist. Its horns were of one piece with it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He covered its top, all its sides and its horns with pure gold. And he made a piece of gold to go around it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made two gold rings to put under this piece. He put one on the altar’s left side and one on its right side to hold the long pieces of wood used for carrying it.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the long pieces of acacia wood and covered them with gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he made the holy oil for pouring, and the pure, sweet-smelling perfume of spices, the work of an able workman.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the altar for burnt gifts of acacia wood. It was as long and as wide as three steps, and as tall as a man’s chest.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made horns on its four corners of one piece with it and covered it with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made all the objects of the altar, its pails, its tools for picking up the ashes, its pots, meat-hooks and fire-holders of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made a net for it of brass. It was put under the altar and it came up half-way.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put four rings of brass at the four corners of the net to hold the long pieces of wood.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the long pieces of wood out of acacia wood and covered them with brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the long pieces of wood through the rings on each side of the altar for carrying it. He made the altar with pieces of wood so it was empty inside.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the pot for washing and its base of brass. They were made from the mirrors of the women servants who worked at the door of the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the open space for the holy tent. On the south side were curtains for the open space. They were made of fine linen, as long as fifty long steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: They hung from twenty pillars with twenty brass bases. The hooks of the pillar and their rings were made of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the north side there were curtains as long as fifty long steps, and twenty pillars with twenty brass bases. The hooks of the pillars and their rings were made of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the west side there were curtains as long as twenty-five long steps. They had ten pillars with ten bases. The hooks of the pillars and their rings were made of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: The east side was as wide as twenty-five long steps.
speaker: Narrator

text: The curtains for one side of the gate were as long as seven steps. They had three pillars with three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the other side there were curtains as long as seven steps, with three pillars and three bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the curtains around the open space were made of fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: The bases for the pillars were made of brass. The hooks of the pillars and their rings were made of silver. Their tops were covered with silver. And the pillars were joined with silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: The curtain for the gate of the open space was the work of an able workman. It was made of blue, purple and red cloth and fine linen. It was as long as ten long steps, and as high as a man raises his hand, to go with the curtains around the open space.
speaker: Narrator

text: Its four pillars and their bases were made of brass. Their hooks and rings were made of silver. And their tops were covered with silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the nails of the meeting tent and the open space were made of brass.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the number of the things for the meeting tent, the meeting tent of the Law, as they were given by the mouth of Moses, for the work of the Levites, under the leading of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the religious leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel, the son of Uri, son of Hur, of the family of Judah, made all that the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: With him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the family of Dan. He was an able workman who cut words in stone, gold or silver, and in sewing blue, purple and red cloth and fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the gold used for the work of the holy tent, the gold given as a gift in worship, weighed as much as twelve men.
speaker: Narrator

text: The silver given by the people weighed as much as forty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each one of the men who were twenty years old and older, added up to 603,550 men, gave only a small weight of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: One hundred heavy weights of silver were used for making the bases for the holy tent and for the curtain in front of the most holy place. One hundred bases were made from the heavy weights of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from the heavy weights of silver he made hooks and joining parts for the pillars, and also covered their tops.
speaker: Narrator

text: The brass that was given weighed as much as thirty men.
speaker: Narrator

text: With it he made the base for the door of the meeting tent, the brass altar and its brass net, and all the objects of the altar.
speaker: Narrator

text: He also made bases all around the open space and the base for the gate of the open space, and all the nails of the meeting tent and all around the open space.
speaker: Narrator

text: They used the blue, purple and red cloth for the well-made clothing for those working in the holy place. They made the holy clothing for Aaron, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the linen vest of gold and blue, purple and red cloth and fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: They beat the gold into plates. Then they cut them into strings to be sewed in with the blue, purple and red cloth and the fine linen, the work of an able workman.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made shoulder pieces for the linen vest, joined at its two top ends.
speaker: Narrator

text: The well-made belt on it was made of the same gold, and blue, purple and red cloth and fine linen, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They set the onyx stones into beautiful pieces of gold. The names of Israel’s sons were cut in the stones like the writing on a ring by an able workman.
speaker: Narrator

text: They were put on the shoulder pieces of the linen vest, to help them remember the sons of Israel, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bezalel made the breast-piece, the work of an able workman. It was like the work of the linen vest, of gold, and blue, purple and red cloth and fine linen.
speaker: Narrator

text: It was as long as it was wide, with one half laid over the other. It was made as long and as wide as a man’s fingers can spread.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put four rows of stones on it. The first row was a ruby, a topaz and an emerald.
speaker: Narrator

text: The second row was a turquoise, a sapphire and a diamond.
speaker: Narrator

text: The third row was a jacinth, an agate and an amethyst.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the fourth row was a beryl, an onyx and a jasper. They were set in beautiful pieces of gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: Each of the twelve stones had written on it the name of one of the sons of Israel. Each name spoke of one of the twelve family groups.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made chains for the breast-piece, like ropes of pure gold.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made two gold rings and put them on the two ends of the breast-piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: They joined the two gold chains to the two rings at the ends of the breast-piece.
speaker: Narrator

text: They joined the other two ends of the two chains to the beautiful gold pieces that hold the two stones at the shoulders, joining them in the front.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made two gold rings to put on the two ends of the breast-piece, on the inside next to the linen vest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they made two gold rings and put them on the bottom of the two shoulder pieces of the linen vest in front, near where they join. They were above the belt of the linen vest.
speaker: Narrator

text: They tied the rings of the breast-piece to the rings of the linen vest with a blue rope. So the breast-piece could not come loose from the linen vest, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he made the long piece of clothing all of blue.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was an opening at its top in the center. Around the opening it was sewed like the opening on heavy battle-clothes, so it could not be torn.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made pomegranates of blue, purple and red cloth and fine linen, to put all around the bottom of this clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made bells of pure gold. And they put the bells between the pomegranates all around the bottom of the clothing.
speaker: Narrator

text: They put a bell and then a pomegranate all around the bottom of this clothing. It was for the work of the Lord, and was just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made the long coats of fine linen for Aaron and his sons.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made the beautiful head coverings of fine linen and the clothing that covered the flesh from the belt to the legs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they made the wide belt of fine linen and blue, purple and red cloth which was the work of an able workman, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They made the plate of the holy crown of pure gold. And they cut in it like the writings on a ring: “Holy to the Lord.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They joined it to the front of the head covering with a blue rope, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the work of the holy tent, the meeting tent, was finished. The sons of Israel did all that the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the meeting tent to Moses, the tent and all its objects, its hooks, all kinds of pieces of wood, pillars and bases.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the covering of rams’ skins made red, the covering of badgers’ skins, and the curtain to hang in front of the most holy place.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the special box of the agreement, its long pieces of wood for carrying it and its mercy-seat,
speaker: Narrator

text: the table and all its objects, the bread to be put before the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: the pure gold lamp-stand with its lamps, all its objects and the oil for the light.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the gold altar, the oil for holy use, the sweet-smelling perfume, and the curtain for the door of the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the brass altar, its brass net, its long pieces of wood for carrying it and all its objects, the washing pot and its stand,
speaker: Narrator

text: the curtains for the open space, its pillars and bases, the curtain for the gate of the open space, its ropes and nails, and all the tools for the work of the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: They brought the clothing for the work in the holy place, the holy clothing for Aaron the religious leader, and the clothing of his sons for their work as religious leaders.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people of Israel did all the work just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses looked at all the work and saw they had done it just as the Lord had said. So Moses gave thanks and prayed that good would come to them.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord said to Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Set up the holy tent, the meeting tent, on the first day of the first month.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put the special box of the Law there. And hang the curtain in front of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring in the table and set its objects on it. Bring in the lamp-stand and light its lamps.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set the gold altar of special perfume in front of the box of the Law. Hang the curtain for the door of the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set the altar of burnt gifts in front of the door of the holy tent, the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Set the washing pot between the meeting tent and the altar and put water in it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hang the curtains all around the open space and hang the curtain at the gate of the open space.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then take the oil and pour it upon the meeting tent and all that is in it. Set it apart with all its objects, and it will be holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour the oil upon the altar of burnt gifts and all its objects. Set the altar apart, and it will be most holy.
speaker: Narrator

text: Pour the oil upon the washing pot and its stand, to set it apart.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the meeting tent. And wash them with water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Put the holy clothing on Aaron. Then pour oil upon him and set him apart to work for Me as a religious leader.
speaker: Narrator

text: Bring his sons and put long coats on them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then pour oil upon them as you have done to their father, so they may serve Me as religious leaders. Pouring oil upon them will make them ready to be religious leaders, they and all their children-to-come.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses did all that the Lord told him to do.
speaker: Narrator

text: On the first day of the first month of the second year, the meeting tent was set up.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses set up the meeting tent, laid the bases, set up its pieces of wood, put in its cross-pieces and set up its pillars.
speaker: Narrator

text: He spread the covering over the meeting tent. And he put the top covering over it, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he took the Law and put it into the special box. He put the long pieces of wood on the special box of the agreement. And he put the mercy-seat on top of the special box.
speaker: Narrator

text: He brought the special box into the meeting tent and hung the curtain. He put the curtain in front of the special box of the agreement, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he put the table in the meeting tent, on the north side of the tent, outside the curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set the bread in its place on the table before the Lord, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he put the lamp-stand in the meeting tent, away from the table, on the south side of the tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set up the lamps before the Lord, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the gold altar in the tent of meeting, in front of the curtain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he burned sweet-smelling perfume on it, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he hung the curtain at the door of the meeting tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: He set the altar of burnt gifts in front of the door of the meeting tent. And he gave the burnt gift and the grain gift on it, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He put the washing pot between the tent of meeting and the altar, with water in it for washing.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses and Aaron and his sons washed their hands and feet there.
speaker: Narrator

text: They washed when they came into the tent of meeting and when they came near the altar, just as the Lord had told Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: He made the open space all around the meeting tent and the altar. And he hung the curtain for the gate of the open space. So Moses finished the work.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the cloud covered the meeting tent. The shining-greatness of the Lord filled the holy tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses was not able to go into the meeting tent because the cloud had rested upon it and the shining-greatness of the Lord filled the holy tent.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the cloud was lifted from the meeting tent, the people of Israel would go on their way through all their traveling days.
speaker: Narrator

text: But when the cloud was not lifted, they did not move on until the day when it was lifted.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the cloud of the Lord rested on the meeting tent during the day. And fire was in the cloud during the night. It was seen by all the people of Israel as they traveled.
speaker: Narrator
